CI = Credible Interval

Some factors can predict Alzheimer’s Disease with more accuracy than others. People with low Functional Assessment test scores, low Activities of Daily Living scores, memory complaints, and behavioral problems had the highest odds of predicting Alzheimer’s. Using health data from 2149 patients ages 60-90, this project explores the most effective predictors of Alzheimer’s disease as of now. The model predicts whether or not a person has an Alzheimer’s diagnosis based on multiple physiological and psychological measures along with age and gender.

title: About
text:
My name is Jason Fisher, I’m a senior at Pearland High School. Email: jasonfisher2025@gmail.com Github: https://github.com/jasonfisher0
My project examines factors that can be used to predict an Alzheimer’s diagnosis in people aged 60-90. Repo: https://github.com/jasonfisher0/finalproj
This project was created as a part of Kane’s Data Science Bootcamp: https://bootcamp.davidkane.info/
